info.title: Law
info.description:
API to access DATEV Anwalt classic (OnPremise). 
The API only enables GET requests. There will no longer be an extension to enable write access (POST / PUT) in OnPremise.

To shrink excessive data transfers, all resources uses a *top* parameter of *100* if this has not been set.
info.x-datev-shortdescription: API to access DATEV Anwalt. Use http://localhost:58454/, https://localhost:58452/ or https://[machinename]:58452/ as the base URL.

tags.name: health
tags.description: Contains all resources to query the health status of the REST API server

tags.name: expenses
tags.description: Contains all resources to administrate expenses.

tags.name: employees
tags.description: Contains all resources to query or administrate employees.

tags.name: files
tags.description: Contains all resources to query or administrate a file.

tags.name: masterdata
tags.description: Contains all resources to query or administrate basic information for a law office

get.summary: Checks if the server is alive

200.description: Returns an object of health information.

get.summary: Get all expense types (de: Aufwandarten)
get.description:
The expense types endpoint returns information about the available *expense types*.
The response includes the display name and other details about each type.
Currently the property `visibility` is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: short_name ASC*

parameters.name: visibility
parameters.description: Possible values: none | all | lawyer | notary

get.summary: Get a specific expense type (de: Aufwandart) by its id
get.description: The expense types endpoint returns information about a specific *expense type* by ID.

get.summary: Gets all expense category values (de: Abrechnungsarten).
get.description:
The billing categories endpoint returns information about all existing *billing category* values.
By default only visible *billing category* values are returned.
*Default sort order: id ASC*

get.summary: Get a specific billing category by its number
get.description: The billing categories endpoint returns information about a specific *billing category* by its number.

get.summary: Gets all expense categories.
get.description: The expense categories endpoint returns information about all existing *expense categories*. It gets the categories of expenses (de: Auslagen), own-expense (de: Eigenaufwand) and tax expenses (de: steuerpflichtige Auslagen). *Default sort order: id ASC*

get.summary: Get a specific expense category by its number.
get.description: The expense category endpoint returns information about a specific *expense category* by its number. It gets the categories of expenses (de: Auslagen), own-expense (de: Eigenaufwand) and tax expenses (de: steuerpflichtige Auslagen).

get.summary: Gets all fee versions (de: Gebührenversion).
get.description:
The fee versions endpoint returns information about all existing *fee versions*.
*Default sort order: id ASC*

get.summary: Get a specific fee version by its number (de: Gebührenversion).
get.description: The fee version endpoint returns information about a specific *fee version* by its number.

get.summary: Gets all expenses (de: Aufwände).
get.description:
The expenses endpoint returns information about all available *expense*.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *expenses*.
The response includes the display name and other details about each type.
Currently the properties `object_type`, `case_handler_id`, `expense_type_id`,
`start`, `end`, `creator_id`, `modifier_id`, `billed`, `invoice_id`,
`invoice_key`, `billing_category`, `file_id`, `client_id`,
`fee_version` and `billable` are not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: start DESC*

parameters.name: billed
parameters.description: The billed status of the expense (yes, no, reserved).

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: The category id of the expense. See /expense-categories/

200.description: An array of expenses. This can be [Taxable-Expense](#model-Taxable-Expense "Go to Type definition"), [Time-Expense](#model-Time-Expense "Go to Type definition") or [Own-Expense](#model-Own-Expense "Go to Type definition").

get.summary: Get a specific expense (de: Aufwand) object identified by its id.
get.description:
The expense objects endpoint returns information about a specific *expense object* by ID.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *expenses*.

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets all employees.
get.description:
The employees endpoint returns information about all existing *employees*.
The response includes the display name and other details about each employees.
Currently the properties `functions`, `job_titles`, `display_name`, `phone`,
`email`, and `branch` are not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: employee_number ASC*
By default only active employees are returned.

get.summary: Get a specific employee by its id
get.description: The employee endpoint returns information about a specific *employee* by ID.

get.summary: Gets all contingency fees of an employee (de: Stundensatzvereinbarung).
get.description:
The contingency fees endpoint returns information about a specific *employees* contingency fees.
Only extern visible contingency fees are returned.
Currently the property `file_id`, `client_id` and `object_type` is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: object_type ASC, file_id DESC (if present), client_id ASC (if present), valid_from DESC, expense_type_id ASC*

200.description: OK. Returns a *contingency-fee* object. This can be `Contingency-Fee`, `Contingency-Fee-By-File` or `Contingency-Fee-By-Client`

get.summary: Gets all custom fields of an employee.
get.description:
The endpoint returns information about all custom fields of a specific employee.
Currently this resource is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: name ASC*

get.summary: Gets all departments (de: Referate).
get.description:
"The departments endpoint returns information about all existing *departments*.
Fields of activity of a law firm: e.g. Civil law, administrative law, ...
The items are sorted by ordered by their number.
*Default sort order: number ASC*"

get.summary: Get a specific department by its id (de: Referat).
get.description:
"The department endpoint returns information about a specific *department* by ID.
Fields of activity of a law firm: e.g. Civil law, administrative law, ..."

get.summary: Gets all available causes.
get.description:
"The causes endpoint returns information about all existing *causes* (de: Gegenstände).
*Default sort order: number ASC*"

get.summary: Gets all available security zones.
get.description:
The security zones endpoint returns information about all existing *security zones*.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *security zones*.
*Default sort order: short_name ASC*

get.summary: Gets all available levels of jurisdiction or order for payment procedure (de: Gerichtsinstanzen / -verfahren).
get.description:
The level of jurisdiction endpoint returns information about all existing *level of jurisdictions*.
*Default sort order: number ASC*

200.description: An array of levels of jurisdictions.

get.summary: Gets all files (de: Akten).
get.description:
The files endpoint returns information about all existing *files*.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*.
By default, only active files are returned ordered by their file number.
Currently only the following properties are filter- and sortable:
`id`, `file_number`, `file_number_short`, `file_name`, `project_number`,
`short_reason`, `reactivated`, `note`
*Default sort order: file_number_short*

get.summary: Get a specific file by its id (de: Akte)
get.description:
The files endpoint returns information about a specific *file*.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*.

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets the reference sheet of the given file (de: Handaktenbogen).
get.description:
The reference sheet contains an overview of the most important information on the respective mandate and, of course, the process register number. 
By default, the address and telephone details of the parties involved, lawyers and institutions are noted there.

parameters.name: show_participants
parameters.description: If `true` the participant part will be processed, otherwise not.

parameters.name: show_notes
parameters.description: If `true` the notes part will be processed, otherwise not.

parameters.name: show_vita
parameters.description: If `true` the vita part will be processed, otherwise not.

parameters.name: show_invoices
parameters.description: If `true` the invoices part will be processed, otherwise not.

parameters.name: show_appointments
parameters.description: If `true` the appointments part will be processed, otherwise not.

parameters.name: show_period
parameters.description: If `true` the periods part will be processed, otherwise not.

200.description: The reference sheet as *HTML* processed content.

text/html.example:

get.summary: Gets all levels of jurisdiction or order for payment procedure of the given file (de: Gerichtsinstanzen / -verfahren).
get.description:
The levels of jurisdiction endpoint returns information about all existing *levels of jurisdictions* of the given file.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*.
Currently the property `active` is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: number ASC*

200.description: An array of levels of jurisdiction.

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets all customer created properties attached to a file.
get.description:
The *custom fields* endpoint returns information about all existing *custom fields* of the given file.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*.
*Default sort order: name ASC*

200.description: An array of custom field items.

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets all parties attached to the file.
get.description:
The parties endpoint returns information about all parties of the given file.
The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*.
Currently the properties `party_name`, `party_name_modified` and `indirect_parties` are not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: part_role_id ASC, serial_number ASC*

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets all custom fields of a party who is in relation to the given file.
get.description:
The endpoint returns information about all custom fields of a specific party.
*Default sort order: name ASC*

get.summary: Gets the budget of the file.
get.description: The endpoint to get the budget of the given *file*. It takes car of non-billable hours. The result set is limited by IAM for the querying user to permitted *files*. Currently the properties `sum_time_expenses`, `sum_taxable_expenses` and `unused_budget` are not filter- and sortable.

200.description: The calculated values of the budget.

404.description: ID not found. This occurs when the ID either does not exist or the rights to read the data are missing.

get.summary: Gets all available *party roles* (de: Beteiligungsarten).
get.description:
The endpoint returns all available *party roles*.
*Default sort order: number ASC*

get.summary: Gets a specific *party role* (de: Beteiligungsart).
get.description: The endpoint returns a single *party role*.

get.summary: Gets all available *accounting areas* (de: Buchungskreise).
get.description:
The endpoint returns all available *accounting areas*.
Currently the property `taxation_method` is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: number ASC*

get.summary: Get a specific *accounting area* (de: Buchungskreise).
get.description: The endpoint returns a specific *accounting area*.

get.summary: Gets all customer created properties (de: Freie Felder).
get.description:
The endpoint returns all available *custom fields* for all domains. 
These *custom fields* contain the metadata like *datatype, length, ...*.
Currently the property `relation` is not filter- and sortable.
*Default sort order: relation ASC, name ASC*

Health.description: The definition of the Health object

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *Expense-Type* (de: Aufwandart).

start_time.description: The start datetime (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14)) of the running process.

process_id.description: The process id of the running REST API.

individual_checks.description: Contains individual health checks with their result.

items.description: Contains a single health check with its result.

Expense-Type.description: Defines the type of expense (de: Aufwandart)

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *Expense-Type* (de: Aufwandart).

short_name.description: Contains the short name of the expense type

name.description: Contains the long name of the expense type

unit_name.description: Contains the unit name of taxable expense types. With other expense types this property will be empty. E.g. *Kilometer, Stunden, Dateien, ...*

unit_rate.description: The factor which will be multiplied with the unit defined in a taxable expense. (de: EinheitenSatz, EUR / Einheit; The unit rate)

note.description: Contains details of the expense type

Billing-Category.description: Contains the billing category (e.g. Nicht abrechenbar, Abrechenbar Post- und Telekommunikationsentgelte, Abrechenbar Dokumentenpauschale, Abrechenbar Reisekosten, Nach Vereinbarung, Abrechenbar sonstige Auslagen)

id.description: The id as integer of the category

Expense-Category.description: Contains the category (e.g. expense, time expense, own expense)

id.description: The id as integer of the category

Fee-Version.description: Contains the fee versions for invoices (e.g. BRAGO/KostO 1994, BRAGO/KostO 2002, RVG/KostO bis 31.07.2013, RVG/GNotKG ab 01.08.2013).

id.description: The id as integer of the fee version.

name.description: The display name of the fee version.

Expense-Type-Visibility.description: Defines the visibility for a specific group of persons.

Base-Expense.description: Contains information about a single *base expense* object. This is the base class for all expense types. This type should *NOT* be used directly. Use the inherited types instead.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *expense* object.

case_handler_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned case handler.

case_handler_link.description: The link to the assigned case handler.

expense_type_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned *expense type*.

expense_type_link.description: The link to the assigned *expense type*.

unit_value.description: Factor by which *hourly rate* is multiplied (de: Einheiten)

billed.description: Current status of the record for billing. If `yes`, the dataset is already billed in an invoice, if `reserved` it is already considered in an invoice design, if `no` it is not included in any invoice or invoice design.

invoice_id.description: The id of the related invoice.

invoice_key.description: The key of the related invoice.

internal_note.description: An internal note. It is possible to get this value printed on invoices

creator_id.description: The id of the *creator* of this record.

modifier_id.description: The id of the *modifier* of this record.

Taxable-Expense.description: Contains information about a single expense object (de: steuerpflichtige Auslagen).

file_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned file.

file_link.description: The link to the assigned file.

client_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned client.

client_link.description: The link to the assigned client.

used_colored_paper.description: `true` if pages are printed in colored mode, otherwise `false`.

amount.description: The amount of the tax expense.

currency.description: The currency unit associated with a currency amount (de: Belegwährung). The currency is shown e.g. on an invoice. The currency in short form.

Time-Expense.description: Contains information about a single *time expense* object (de: Zeitaufwand).

file_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned file.

file_link.description: The link to the assigned file.

client_id.description: The Unique identifier of the assigned client.

client_link.description: The link to the assigned client.

unit_rate.description: de: EinheitenSatz, EUR / Einheit; The internal hourly rate

amount.description: The result of the product of `amount = unit_rate * unit_value`. This can be overwritten by the user.

actual_effort.description: If `true`, this expense is imaginary effort, otherwise `false` if the activity actually took time

billable.description: If `true`, this expense should be used in an invoice, otherwise `false`.

Own-Expense.description: Contains information about a single *own expense* (de: Eigenaufwand) object.

unit_rate.description: de: EinheitenSatz, EUR / Einheit; The internal hourly rate

amount.description: The result of the product of `amount = unit_rate * unit_value`. This can be overwritten by the user.

actual_effort.description: If `true`, this expense is imaginary effort, otherwise `false` if the activity actually took time

billable.description: If `true`, this expense should be used in an invoice, otherwise `false`. Own expenses are never billable. So the value is always `false`.

Employee.description: Contains information about a office employee.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *employee* object.

addressee_id.description: Id of the referenced SDD addressee.

addressee_link.description: The link to the referenced SDD addressee.

employee_number.description: With the employee number each employee is unique identifiable.

degree.description: The title or academic grad of the employee.

title_of_nobility.description: The nobility title of the employee.

name_prefix.description: The prefix of the employees name, e.g. `an der; von und zu; ...`

display_name.description: The formatted, human readable name of the employee. E.g. `<Lastname>, <Firstname>`

correspondence_name.description: The formatted, human readable name of the employee used in letters. E.g. `<Firstname> <Lastname>`

phone.description: Phone number, valid length is between 1 and 60 characters and \ format has to correspond to '+49 123 456789'. It may also be a call-through number.

email.description: Email address, valid length is between 1 and 60 characters and format has to correspond to 'sample@example.com'.

fax.description: Fax number, valid length is between 1 and 60 characters and \ format has to correspond to '+49 123 456789'. It may also be a call-through number.

functions.description: Contains job descriptions or specialized lawyer description (e.g. lawyer, tax accountant, specialized lawyer in administrative law, ...)

items.description: Contains a job description or specialized lawyer description (e.g. lawyer, tax accountant, specialized lawyer in administrative law, ...)

assistant_id.description: The id of the referenced assistant.

assistant_link.description: The link to the referenced assistant object.

initials.description: The initials of the employee for use in a letter (de: Diktatzeichen).

profit_center.description: Contains the name of the assigned profit center.

job_titles.description: The jobs the employee is assigned to.

items.description: Defines the employee job. E.g. case handler, lawyer, notary, tax_accountant

id.description: The id as integer of the job

branch.description: The branch the employee is assigned to.

id.description: The id of the branch.

company.description: The company the branch is assigned to.

id.description: The id of the company.

Contingency-Fee.description: Contains information about a contingency fee of an employee.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *contingency fee* object.

unit_rate.description: The hourly rate for this file (de: Stundensatz).

note.description: The note to the contingency fee.

document_currency.description: The currency of the hourly rate.

valid_from.description: Defines the start date from which the value is valid (As defined by *date* - [RFC3339, section 5.6](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3339.html#section-5.6))

Contingency-Fee-By-File.description: Contains information about a contingency fee of an employee related to a file (de: Stundensatzvereinbarung mit Aktenbezug).

file_link.description: The link to the related file.

Contingency-Fee-By-Client.description: Contains information about a contingency fee of an employee related to a client.

client_link.description: The link to the related client.

Case-Handler.description: The case handler of a file (de: Sachbearbeiter)

id.description: The id of the case handler

number.description: The number of the case handler

display_name.description: The display name of the case handler in format `<Firstname> <Surname>`

primary_case_handler.description: Flag if this case handler is the primary case handler of the file.

commission.description: Share of the case handler in the revenue distribution of the file

employee_id.description: The id of the related employee.

Security-Zone.description: The security zone allows to restrict access to a file (de: Sicherheitsbereich).

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *security zone* object.

short_name.description: The short name of the security zone

name.description: The name of the security zone

Levels-Of-Jurisdiction.description: The possible levels of jurisdiction or order for payment procedure defined in masterdata (de: Gerichtsinstanz / -verfahren).

id.description: The number of the active level or order for payment procedure

name.description: The name of the active level or order for payment procedure, z.B. 'Mahnverfahren', '1. Instanz', ...

Levels-Of-Jurisdiction-File-Related.description: The level of jurisdiction or order for payment procedure (de: Gerichtsinstanz / Mahnverfahren einer Akte) file related.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *level of jurisdiction* object of a file.

number.description: The number of the active level or order for payment procedure

name.description: The name of the active level or order for payment procedure, z.B. 'Mahnverfahren', '1. Instanz', ...

active.description: `true` to mark a level of jurisdiction as the active one. Otherwise `false`

File.description: Contains information about a lawyer or notary file.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *file* object.

file_number.description: The file number like *000001-2008/001:00* with location part.

file_name.description: The name of the file (de: Aktenbezeichnung) *Manfred Mustermandant ./. Martin Mustergegner*

short_reason.description: Describes the legal basis of a file, e.g. Warenlieferung, Scheidung, ...

long_reason.description: Describes the legal basis of a file, e.g. Warenlieferung, Scheidung, ... Is identical to `short_reason`, only with the exception that here a longer reason can be included

department.description: Specifies the department (de: Referat) where the *custom field* should be visible. If the value is *null* the *custom field* should be visible on all departments.

id.description: Unique identifier representing the referenced *department* object.

link.description: The link to the specific department.

causes.description: The collection of causes assigned to the file.

partner.description: The case handler who is partner of the file. This can only be an employee who is case handler.

id.description: The id of the case handler

number.description: The number of the case handler

display_name.description: The display name of the case handler in format `<Firstname> <Surname>`

link.description: The link to the employee. See '/employees/{id}'

case_handlers.description: The collection of assigned case handlers (de: Sachbearbeiter).

establishment.description: The establishment (de: Niederlassung) the file is assigned to.

link.description: The link to the establishment content.

organization.description: The organization (de: Unternehmen) the establishment is assigned to.

id.description: The id of the organization.

link.description: The link to the establishment content.

economic_data.description: Contains all economy data (de: wirtschaftliche Daten).

accounting_area.description: Contains a subset of the assigned accounting area.

id.description: The id of the accounting area.

name.description: Display name of the accounting area

link.description: The link to the assigned accounting area.

reactivated.description: Flag to sign, if the file was first filed and after a while was reactivated to an active file

filing.description: This property is only filled, if the file was already filed

date.description: The datetime the file was filed (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

retention_period_end.description: The time after that the file gets deleted (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

location.description: The location the law is filed

note.description: Contains a note to the file. The content can be plain text or RTF.

created.description: The creation information of the file

date.description: The datetime the file was created (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

creator.description: The user name who created the file

modified.description: The last modification information of the file

date.description: The datetime the file was last modified (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

creator.description: The user name who last modified the file

Budget.description: The budget values of the current file.

id.description: The unique number of the budget.

budget.description: The budget of the current file.

sum_time_expenses.description: The sum of all time expenses.

sum_taxable_expenses.description: The sum of all taxable expenses.

Economical-Client.description: The economical client (de: betriebswirtschaftlicher Mandant) of the current file.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *Economical-Client* (de: betriebswirtschaftlicher Mandant).

number.description: The client number each client is unique identifiable.

name.description: The formatted, human readable name of the employee. E.g. `<Lastname>, <Firstname>`

link.description: The link to the assigned client.

Cause.description: The cause a file is needed (de: Gegenstand)

id.description: The unique number of the case

department_id.description: Assignment of the cause to a department

department_link.description: The link to the assigned department.

Department.description:
"Contains information about a department a file is assigned to (de: Referat).
Fields of activity of a law firm: e.g. Civil law, administrative law, ..."

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *department* object.
The id of the cause

Custom-Field-Definition.description: A customer created property attached to a file or an addressee. This type contains the metadata of a *custom property*.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *custom field* object.

relation.description: Defines the relation. If this custom field can be used in conjunction with a file, `file` is used. If this custom field can be used in conjunction with an addressee, `addressee` is used.

length.description: The maximum length of the value.

department.description: Specifies the department (de: Referat) where the *custom field* should be visible. If the value is *null* the *custom field* should be visible on all departments.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *department* object.

link.description: The link to the specific department.

Custom-Field.description: A customer created property attached to a file or an addressee.

id.description: The unique number of the *custom field*

value.description: The specific value attached to a file or an addressee.

Party-Role.description: The *role* how a *party* is attached to a file.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *party role* object.

short_name.description: The short name of the *party role*.

Party.description: A *party* who is attached to the file. This can be a client, an opponent, etc.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *party* object.

party_role_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *party role* object.

party_role_link.description: The link to the assigned *party role*.

party_role.description: If the object is expanded this property is filled. Otherwise `null`

serial_number.description: the serial number of a *party* within a *party role*

address_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *addressee* object in SDD.

address_link.description: The link to the assigned addressee.

subject.description: The subject specific for this *party*. By default this will be identical to the *Aktenbezeichnung* of the file.

entitled_to_deduct_input_vat.description: `true` if the *party* is entitled to deduct input VAT (de: vorsteuerabzugsberechtigt).

client_id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *client* object in SDD.

client_link.description: The link to the assigned client.

party_name.description: Contains the description of how the person is represented in the title of a judgment (de: Rubrum).

party_name_modified.description: `true` if the user has modified the *party_name*

official_party_type.description: Describes the `party role` in more detail (de: Fachbeteiligung)

indirect_parties.description: Contains an array of indirectly involved *parties*.

Accounting-Area.description: Used for financial administration in an office. Smallest organizational unit of external accounting, for which a complete, self-contained accounting can be mapped.

id.description: Unique identifier representing a specific *accounting area* object.

fiscal_year.description: Contains information about the fiscal year of the accounting area.

previous_year_start.description: The datetime the previous fiscal year started (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

current_year_start.description: The datetime the current fiscal year started (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

current_year_end.description: The datetime the current fiscal year ends (As defined by *date-time* - [RFC3339](http://xml2rfc.ietf.org/public/rfc/html/rfc3339.html#anchor14))

general_ledger_account_length.description: The length of the number of a *general ledger account* (de: Sachkontenlänge)

general_ledger_accounts_frame.description: Defines the default *DATEV chart of accounts* (de: Sachkontenrahmen).

taxation_method.description: The taxation method used for the current *accounting area* (de: Versteuerungsart)

payment_target.description: The payment target for invoices in days (de: Zahlungsziel)

transfer_path.description: The filesystem directory to provide accounting transactions for *DATEV Rechnungswesen* (de: Übergabepfad).

id.description: id of additional message

Id.name: id
Id.description: The id of the queried object

Number.name: number
Number.description: The number of the queried object

Top.name: top
Top.description:
Defines how many elements should be read. For paging this is used in combination with *skip* parameter.
**To shrink excessive data transfers, all resources uses a *top* parameter of *100* if this has not been set.**

Skip.name: skip
Skip.description: Defines how many elements to skip in read process. For paging this is used in combination with *top* parameter.

Select.name: select
Select.description: Enter relevant attributes to which the results will then be limited.

Filter.name: filter
Filter.description:
Contains a filter expression according to the filter syntax in the REST guidelines.
E.g.: filter=number eq 10000

Operators:
| Operator                        | Description                                                   | Example                         |
|---------------------------------|---------------------------------------------------------------|---------------------------------|
| eq                              | Equal                                                         | city eq 'Nuremberg'             |
| ne                              | Not Equal                                                     | city ne 'Munich'                |
| gt                              | Greater than                                                  | price gt 20                     |
| ge                              | Greater than or equal                                         | price ge 10                     |
| lt                              | Less than                                                     | price lt 20                     |
| le                              | Less than or equal                                            | price le 100                    |
| startswith(property, substring) | Search for Substring at the beginning of the property's value | startswith(client_name, 'Mü')   |
| contains(property, substring)   | Search for Substring in property's value                      | contains(client_name, 'alg')    |
| and                             | Logical and                                                   | price gt 10 and price le 20     |
| or                              | Logical or                                                    | price eq 10 or price eq 20      |
| not                             | Logical negation                                              | price gt 10 and not price eq 15 |

OrderBy.name: orderby
OrderBy.description: Enables the sorting of the content
